dataIdInfo.idCredit: Author: NJ Office of Information Technology, Office of GIS. Support: njgin@oit.state.nj.us Bugs: email support, subject: "NJ Road Editor Add-In"

dataIdInfo.idAbs: The delete tool is a button tool on the NJ Road Editor toolbar. It can only be used during an edit session. To use the tool, simply select 1 segment in the SEGMENT feature class (note: this does not work for SEGMENT_CHANGE), and press the Delete button. This will launch the Delete tool dialog with options for how to make the delete in the database.

tool.name: Delete

param.name: create SEGMENT_CHANGE
param.dialogReference:
If checked (default), the selected segment will be inserted into SEGMENT_CHANGE feature class as "Removed". There will be no corresponding entry in SEGMENT_TRANS becasue there is no new segment to replace it.

In SEGMENT_CHANGE;

CHANGE_ID - Null

SEG_GUID_ARCH - SEG_GUID from SEGMENT

CHANGE_TYPE_ID - "R -Removed"

COMMENTS - Null

If unchecked, no record will be inserted into SEGMENT_CHANGE.

param.name: delete SEGMENT_COMMENTS
param.displayname: Delete all existing records in SEGMENT_COMMENTS?
param.dialogReference:
If checked (default), all records in the SEGMENT_COMMENTS table with a matching SEG_GUID will be deleted from the database.

If unchecked, no records will be deleted from the SEGMENT_COMMENTS table.

param.name: new_comment
param.dialogReference:
If checked, a new record will be inserted in SEGMENT_COMMENTS table. This also forces the "Create record in SEGMENT_CHANGE?" box to be checked, becasue there can't be SEGMENT_COMMENTS records without a corresponding record in SEGMENT_CHANGE or SEGMENT. The COMMENTS and RANK fields will be enabled.

If unchecked (default), no new records will be inserted into SEGMENT_COMMENTS.

param.name: comments
param.dialogReference: COMMENTS field for entry into SEGMENT_COMMENTS. Enabled when "Create new record in SEGMENT_COMMENTS?" is checked.

param.name: rank
param.dialogReference: RANK field for entry into SEGMENT_COMMENTS. Enabled when "Create new record in SEGMENT_COMMENTS?" is checked.

tool.summary: The delete tool is a button tool on the NJ Road Editor toolbar. It can only be used during an edit session. To use the tool, simply select 1 segment in the SEGMENT feature class (note: this does not work for SEGMENT_CHANGE), and press the Delete button. This will launch the Delete tool dialog with options for how to make the delete in the database.
tool.usage: Can be used as a script tool in the Python Add-In environment, or as a geoprocessing tool in the standard Python environment.
